item.title: BlackInData
item.description: Amplifying Black folx in informatics, data science & coding around the world #BlackInData #BlackInDataWeek Nov 16th-21th

item.title: BlackInGenetics
item.description:
BIG is an organization dedicated to amplifying voices and work by Black-identifying geneticists. #BlackInGenetics

Contact us: http://blackingenetics.com/contact

Check out our job board: https://www.blackingenetics.com/job-board

item.title: Breast cancer disparities
item.description: I will leverage The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) and the Carolina Breast Cancer Study (CBCS) [20% and 50% black patients, respectively] to study mutational signatures and their role in breast cancer disparities. We will probe established risk factors for breast cancer. I anticipate that by investigating these relationships in a large, diverse patient population, I will identify novel associations between carcinogenic exposures and tumor biology in cancer disparities.

item.title: Building Relationships to Diversify Graduate Education (BRDGE)
item.description:
**Building Relationships to Diversify Graduate Education ** Founded in 2019 by UNC-CH doctoral student Taylor Y. Dismuke, BRDGE Alliance was designed to be a STEM mentoring program with a goal to bridge the gap​ between underrepresented minorities and the STEM community.

The current focus of BRDGE Alliance is to develop undergraduate students at Historically Black colleges and universities by creating dynamic relationships with black graduate students at research institutions.

With the aim to improve diversity in STEM we will use application of peer mentorship, community, and personal and professional development activities to develop underrepresented students in STEM.

item.title: Liver cancer disparities
item.description: Identify mutational signatures in liver cancer and assess their relationship with environmental exposures and DNA repair markers, overall and by race/ethnicity. I will use mutation data to identify mutational signatures in primary liver cancer and to estimate the relationship of these signatures to exposure markers and DNA repair (such as aflaxtoxin, smoking, alcohol) emphasizing differential incidence among Asian patients.
